FindingName: CIS - 7.2 - 7.10 [VULNERABILITIES] - Mobile Device Audit Returned Incorrect Results
Description: This means that Mobile Device Audit Settings are not configured regarding the CIS Benchmark. This could lead to the following risks: Information Leaking, Information Disclosure, Data Exfiltration, Credential Theft, Weakend Security, Malware Installation}
Remediation: Please change the affected Objects to the Values that are Expected! Set-MobileDebiceMailboxPolicy will help with this.
DefaultValue:
AlphanumericPasswordRequired: False
PasswordEnabled: False
PasswordRecoveryEnabled: False
AllowSimplePassword: True
MinPasswordLength: NULL
MaxPasswordFailedAttempts: Unlimited
PasswordExpiration: Unlimited
PasswordHistory: 0
MinPasswordComplexCharacters: 1
MaxInactivityTimeLock: Unlimited
DeviceEncryptionEnabled: False
ExpectedValue:
AlphanumericPasswordRequired: True
PasswordEnabled: True
PasswordRecoveryEnabled: True
AllowSimplePassword: False
MinPasswordLength: >5
MaxPasswordFailedAttempts: <10
PasswordExpiration: Unlimited
PasswordHistory: >4
MinPasswordComplexCharacters: 1
MaxInactivityTimeLock: <5
DeviceEncryptionEnabled: True

References.Text: 2.2 Ensure Authorized Software is Currently Supported
18.3 Verify That Acquired Software is Still Supported
18.4 Only Use Up-to-date And Trusted Third-Party Components
5 Secure Configuration for Hardware and Software on Mobile Devices, Laptops, Workstations and Servers
4.3 Configure Automatic Session Locking on Enterprise Assets
13.6 Encrypt the Hard Drive of All Mobile Devices.
4.4 Implement and Manage a Firewall on Servers
8.2 Ensure Anti-Malware Software and Signatures are Updated
9.4 Apply Host-based Firewalls or Port Filtering
9.1 Ensure Use of Only Fully Supported Browsers and Email Clients
7.1 Ensure Use of Only Fully Supported Browsers and Email Clients
